achievements.name: BalloonPopped
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of balloons burst. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Popper' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: Count
achievements.desc: Returns the amount of achievements in Garry's Mod.

achievements.name: EatBall
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200, the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: GetGoal
achievements.desc: Retrieves progress goal of given achievement

achievements.name: IncBaddies
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of baddies killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'War Zone' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: IncBystander
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of innocent animals killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Innocent Bystander' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: IncGoodies
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of friendly NPCs killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Bad Friend' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: IsAchieved
achievements.desc: Used in GMod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have unlocked certain achievements.

achievements.name: Remover
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of things removed. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Destroyer' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: SpawnedNPC
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of NPCs spawned. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Procreator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: SpawnedProp
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of props spawned. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Creator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: SpawnedRagdoll
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of ragdolls spawned. Once this count reaches 2000, the 'Dollhouse' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.name: SpawnMenuOpen
achievements.desc: {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened. Once this count reaches 100,000, the 'Menu User' achievement is unlocked.

ai_schedule.name: New
ai_schedule.desc: Creates a schedule for scripted NPC.

ai_task.name: New
ai_task.desc: Create a new empty task. Used by {{ClassFunction|Schedule|AddTask}} and {{ClassFunction|Schedule|EngTask}}.

ai.name: GetTaskID
ai.desc: Returns the task Id corresponding to the given task name.

baseclass.name: Get
baseclass.desc: Gets the base class of an an object.

baseclass.name: Set
baseclass.desc: Sets the base class of an an object.

bit.name: band
bit.desc: Returns the bitwise and of all values specified.

bit.name: bnot
bit.desc: Returns the bitwise not of the value.

bit.name: bor
bit.desc: Returns the bitwise OR of all values specified.

bit.name: bxor
bit.desc: Returns the bitwise xor of all values specified.

bit.name: tobit
bit.desc: Normalizes the specified value and clamps it in the range of a signed 32bit integer.

bit.name: tohex
bit.desc: Returns the hexadecimal representation of the number with the specified digits.

cam.name: ApplyShake
cam.desc: Shakes the screen at a certain position.

cam.name: End
cam.desc: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D or 3D context.

cam.name: End2D
cam.desc: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D context.

cam.name: End3D
cam.desc: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

cam.name: End3D2D
cam.desc: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D2D context.

cam.name: EndOrthoView
cam.desc: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D orthographic rendering context.

cam.name: IgnoreZ
cam.desc: Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.

cam.name: PopModelMatrix
cam.desc: Pops the current active rendering matrix from the stack and reinstates the previous one.

cam.name: PushModelMatrix
cam.desc: Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack. Unlike opengl, this will replace the current model matrix.

cam.name: Start
cam.desc: Sets up a new rendering context. You can easily use this instead of {{LibraryFunction|cam|Start3D}} or {{LibraryFunction|cam|Start2D}}

cam.name: Start2D
cam.desc: Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by {{LibraryFunction|cam|End2D}}.

cam.name: Start3D
cam.snippet: cam.Start3D(${1:Vector pos=EyePos()},${2:Angle angles=EyeAngles()},${3:number fov=nil},${4:number x=0},${5:number y=0},${6:number w=ScrW()},${7:number h=ScrH()},${8:number zNear=nil},${9:number zFar=nil})
cam.desc: Sets up a new 3D rendering context. Must be finished by {{LibraryFunction|cam|End3D}}.

cam.name: Start3D2D
cam.desc: Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by {{LibraryFunction|cam|End3D2D}}.

cam.name: StartOrthoView
cam.desc: Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.

chat.name: AddText
chat.desc: Adds text to the local player's chat box (which only they can read).

cleanup.name: Add
cleanup.desc: Adds an entity to a player's cleanup list.

cleanup.name: CC_AdminCleanup
cleanup.desc: {{Internal}} Called by the ''gmod_admin_cleanup'' console command. Allows admins to clean up the server.

cleanup.name: CC_Cleanup
cleanup.desc: {{Internal}} Called by the ''gmod_cleanup'' console command. Allows players to cleanup their own props.

cleanup.name: GetTable
cleanup.desc: Gets the table of cleanup types.

cleanup.name: ReplaceEntity
cleanup.desc: Replaces one entity in the cleanup module with another

concommand.name: Add
concommand.snippet: concommand.Add(${1:string name},${2:function callback},${3:function autoComplete=nil},${4:string helpText=nil},${5:number flags=0})
concommand.desc: Creates a console command that runs a function in lua with optional autocompletion function and help text.

concommand.name: AutoComplete
concommand.desc: {{Internal}} Used by the engine to call the autocomplete function for a console command, and retrieve returned options.

concommand.name: GetTable
concommand.desc: Returns the tables of all console command callbacks, and autocomplete functions, that were added to the game with {{LibraryFunction|concommand|Add}}.

concommand.name: Run
concommand.desc: {{Internal|You might be looking for {{GlobalFunction|RunConsoleCommand}} or {{ClassFunction|Player|ConCommand}}.}} Used by the engine to run a console command's callback function, that was added with {{LibraryFunction|concommand|Add}}. An error is sent to the player's chat if no callback is found.

constraint.name: AddConstraintTable
constraint.snippet: constraint.AddConstraintTable(${1:Entity ent1},${2:Entity constrt},${3:Entity ent2=nil},${4:Entity ent3=nil},${5:Entity ent4=nil})
constraint.desc: Stores information about constraints in an entity's table.

constraint.name: AddConstraintTableNoDelete
constraint.snippet: constraint.AddConstraintTableNoDelete(${1:Entity ent1},${2:Entity constrt},${3:Entity ent2=nil},${4:Entity ent3=nil},${5:Entity ent4=nil})
constraint.desc: Stores info about the constraints on the entity's table. The only difference between this and {{LibraryFunction|constraint|AddConstraintTable}} is that the constraint does not get deleted when the entity is removed.

constraint.name: AdvBallsocket
constraint.snippet: constraint.AdvBallsocket(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number forcelimit},${8:number torquelimit},${9:number xmin},${10:number ymin},${11:number zmin},${12:number xmax},${13:number ymax},${14:number zmax},${15:number xfric},${16:number yfric},${17:number zfric},${18:number onlyrotation},${19:number nocollide})
constraint.desc: Creates an advanced ballsocket (ragdoll) constraint.

constraint.name: Axis
constraint.snippet: constraint.Axis(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number forcelimit},${8:number torquelimit},${9:number friction},${10:number nocollide},${11:Vector LocalAxis},${12:boolean DontAddTable})
constraint.desc: Creates an axis constraint.

constraint.name: Ballsocket
constraint.snippet: constraint.Ballsocket(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LocalPos},${6:number forcelimit},${7:number torquelimit},${8:number nocollide})
constraint.desc: Creates a ballsocket joint.

constraint.name: CanConstrain
constraint.snippet: constraint.CanConstrain(${1:Entity ent},${2:number bone})
constraint.desc: Basic checks to make sure that the specified entity and bone are valid. Returns false if we should not be constraining the entity.

constraint.name: CreateKeyframeRope
constraint.snippet: constraint.CreateKeyframeRope(${1:Vector pos},${2:number width},${3:string material},${4:Entity Constraint},${5:Entity Ent1},${6:Vector LPos1},${7:number Bone1},${8:Entity Ent2},${9:Vector LPos2},${10:number Bone2},${11:table kv})
constraint.desc: Creates a rope without any constraint

constraint.name: CreateStaticAnchorPoint
constraint.snippet: constraint.CreateStaticAnchorPoint(${1:Vector pos})
constraint.desc: Creates an invisible, non-moveable anchor point in the world to which things can be attached.

constraint.name: Elastic
constraint.snippet: constraint.Elastic(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number constant},${8:number damping},${9:number rdamping},${10:string material},${11:number width},${12:boolean stretchonly})
constraint.desc: Creates an elastic constraint.

constraint.name: Find
constraint.snippet: constraint.Find(${1:Entity ent1},${2:Entity ent2},${3:string type},${4:number bone1},${5:number bone2})
constraint.desc: Returns the constraint of a specified type between two entities, if it exists

constraint.name: FindConstraint
constraint.snippet: constraint.FindConstraint(${1:Entity ent},${2:string type})
constraint.desc: Returns the first constraint of a specific type directly connected to the entity found

constraint.name: FindConstraintEntity
constraint.snippet: constraint.FindConstraintEntity(${1:Entity ent},${2:string type})
constraint.desc: Returns the other entity involved in the first constraint of a specific type directly connected to the entity

constraint.name: FindConstraints
constraint.snippet: constraint.FindConstraints(${1:Entity ent},${2:string type})
constraint.desc: Returns a table of all constraints of a specific type directly connected to the entity

constraint.name: ForgetConstraints
constraint.snippet: constraint.ForgetConstraints(${1:Entity ent})
constraint.desc: Make this entity forget any constraints it knows about. Note that this will not actually remove the constraints.

constraint.name: GetAllConstrainedEntities
constraint.snippet: constraint.GetAllConstrainedEntities(${1:Entity ent},${2:table ResultTable=nil})
constraint.desc: Returns a table of all entities recursively constrained to an entitiy.

constraint.name: GetTable
constraint.snippet: constraint.GetTable(${1:Entity ent})
constraint.desc: Returns a table of all constraints directly connected to the entity

constraint.name: HasConstraints
constraint.snippet: constraint.HasConstraints(${1:Entity ent})
constraint.desc: Returns true if the entity has constraints attached to it

constraint.name: Hydraulic
constraint.snippet: constraint.Hydraulic(${1:Player pl},${2:Entity Ent1},${3:Entity Ent2},${4:number Bone1},${5:number Bone2},${6:Vector LPos1},${7:Vector LPos2},${8:number Length1},${9:number Length2},${10:number width},${11:number key},${12:number fixed},${13:number speed},${14:string material})
constraint.desc: Creates a Hydraulic constraint.

constraint.name: Keepupright
constraint.snippet: constraint.Keepupright(${1:Entity ent},${2:Angle ang},${3:number bone},${4:number angularLimit})
constraint.desc: Creates a keep upright constraint.

constraint.name: Motor
constraint.snippet: constraint.Motor(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number friction},${8:number torque},${9:number forcetime},${10:number nocollide},${11:number toggle},${12:Player pl},${13:number forcelimit},${14:number numpadkey_fwd},${15:number numpadkey_bwd},${16:number direction},${17:Vector LocalAxis})
constraint.desc: Creates a motor constraint.

constraint.name: Muscle
constraint.snippet: constraint.Muscle(${1:Player pl},${2:Entity Ent1},${3:Entity Ent2},${4:number Bone1},${5:number Bone2},${6:Vector LPos1},${7:Vector LPos2},${8:number Length1},${9:number Length2},${10:number width},${11:number key},${12:number fixed},${13:number period},${14:number amplitude},${15:boolean starton},${16:string material})
constraint.desc: Creates a muscle constraint.

constraint.name: NoCollide
constraint.snippet: constraint.NoCollide(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2})
constraint.desc: Creates an no-collide "constraint". Disables collision between two entities.

constraint.name: Pulley
constraint.snippet: constraint.Pulley(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent4},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone4},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos4},${7:Vector WPos2},${8:Vector WPos3},${9:number forcelimit},${10:boolean rigid},${11:number width},${12:string material})
constraint.desc: Creates a pulley constraint.

constraint.name: RemoveAll
constraint.snippet: constraint.RemoveAll(${1:Entity ent})
constraint.desc: Attempts to remove all constraints associated with an entity

constraint.name: RemoveConstraints
constraint.snippet: constraint.RemoveConstraints(${1:Entity ent},${2:string type})
constraint.desc: Attempts to remove all constraints of a specified type associated with an entity

constraint.name: Rope
constraint.snippet: constraint.Rope(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:number Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number length},${8:number addlength},${9:number forcelimit},${10:number width},${11:string material},${12:boolean rigid})
constraint.desc: Creates a rope constraint - with rope!

constraint.name: Slider
constraint.snippet: constraint.Slider(${1:Entity Ent1},${2:Entity Ent2},${3:number Bone1},${4:number Bone2},${5:Vector LPos1},${6:Vector LPos2},${7:number width},${8:string material})
constraint.desc: Creates a slider constraint.

constraint.name: Weld
constraint.snippet: constraint.Weld(${1:Entity ent1},${2:Entity ent2},${3:number bone1},${4:number bone2},${5:number forcelimit},${6:boolean nocollide},${7:boolean deleteent1onbreak})
constraint.desc: Creates a weld constraint

constraint.name: Winch
constraint.snippet: constraint.Winch(${1:Player pl},${2:Entity Ent1},${3:Entity Ent2},${4:number Bone1},${5:number Bone2},${6:Vector LPos1},${7:Vector LPos2},${8:number width},${9:number key},${10:number key},${11:number fwd_speed},${12:number bwd_speed},${13:string material},${14:boolean toggle})
constraint.desc: Creates a Winch constraint.

construct.name: Magnet
construct.snippet: construct.Magnet(${1:Player ply},${2:Vector pos},${3:Angle ang},${4:string model},${5:string material},${6:number key},${7:number maxObjects},${8:number strength},${9:number nopull=0},${10:number allowrot=0},${11:number startOn=0},${12:number toggle},${13:Vector vel=Vector( 0, 0, 0 )},${14:Angle aVel=Angle( 0, 0, 0 )},${15:boolean frozen=false})

construct.name: SetPhysProp
construct.snippet: construct.SetPhysProp(${1:Player ply},${2:Entity ent},${3:number physObjID},${4:PhysObj physObj},${5:table data})

controlpanel.name: Clear
controlpanel.desc: Clears ALL the control panels ( for tools )

controlpanel.name: Get
controlpanel.desc: Returns (or creates if not exists) a controlpanel.

cookie.name: Delete
cookie.desc: Deletes a cookie on the client.

cookie.name: GetNumber
cookie.desc: Gets the value of a cookie on the client as a number.

cookie.name: GetString
cookie.desc: Gets the value of a cookie on the client as a string.

cookie.name: Set
cookie.desc: Sets the value of a cookie, which is saved automatically by the {{Lib|sql}} library.

coroutine.name: create
coroutine.desc: Creates a coroutine of the given function.

coroutine.name: resume
coroutine.desc: Resumes the given coroutine and passes the given vararg to either the function arguments or the {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|yield}} that is inside that function and returns whatever yield is called with the next time or by the final return in the function.

coroutine.name: running
coroutine.desc: Returns the active coroutine or nil if we are not within a coroutine.

coroutine.name: status
coroutine.desc: Returns the status of the coroutine passed to it, the possible statuses are "suspended", "running", and "dead".

coroutine.name: wait
coroutine.desc: Yield's the coroutine for so many seconds before returning.

coroutine.name: wrap
coroutine.desc: Returns a function which calling is equivalent with calling {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} with the coroutine and all extra parameters.

coroutine.name: yield
coroutine.desc: Pauses the active coroutine and passes all additional variables to the call of {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} that resumed the coroutine last time, and returns all additional variables that were passed to the previous call of resume.

cvars.name: AddChangeCallback
cvars.desc: Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.

cvars.name: Bool
cvars.desc: Retrieves console variable as a boolean.

cvars.name: GetConVarCallbacks
cvars.desc: Returns a table of the given ConVars callbacks.

cvars.name: Number
cvars.desc: Retrieves console variable as a number.

cvars.name: RemoveChangeCallback
cvars.desc: Removes a callback for a convar using the the callback's identifier. The identifier should be the third argument specified for {{LibraryFunction|cvars|AddChangeCallback}}.

cvars.name: String
cvars.desc: Retrieves console variable as a string.

debug.name: debug
debug.desc: Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters. Using simple commands and other debug facilities, the user can inspect global and local variables, change their values, evaluate expressions, and so on. A line containing only the word cont finishes this function, so that the caller continues its execution.

debug.name: getfenv
debug.desc: Returns the environment of the passed object. This can be set with {{LibraryFunction|debug|setfenv}}

debug.name: gethook
debug.desc: Returns the current hook settings of the passed thread. The thread argument can be omitted. This is unrelated to [[:Category:GM Hooks|gamemode hooks]]. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

debug.name: getinfo
debug.desc: Returns useful information about a function.

debug.name: getlocal
debug.desc: Gets the name and value of a local variable indexed from the level

debug.name: getmetatable
debug.desc: Returns the metatable of an object. This function ignores the metatable's __metatable field.

debug.name: getregistry
debug.desc: Returns the internal Lua registry table.

debug.name: getupvalue
debug.desc: Used for getting variable values in an index from the passed function

debug.name: setfenv
debug.desc: Sets the environment of the passed object.

debug.name: sethook
debug.desc: Sets the given function as a Lua hook. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. The thread argument can be completely omitted and calling this function with no arguments will remove the current hook. This is used by default for infinite loop detection. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

debug.name: setlocal
debug.snippet: debug.setlocal(${1:thread thread=Current Thread},${2:number level},${3:number index},${4:any value=nil})

debug.name: setupvalue
debug.desc: Sets the variable indexed from func

debug.name: Trace
debug.desc: Prints out the lua function call stack to the console.

debug.name: traceback
debug.desc: Returns a full execution stack trace.

debug.name: upvalueid
debug.desc: Returns an unique identifier for the upvalue indexed from func

debug.name: upvaluejoin
debug.desc: Make the n1-th upvalue of the Lua closure f1 refer to the n2-th upvalue of the Lua closure f2.

debugoverlay.name: Axis
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Axis(${1:Vector origin},${2:Angle ang},${3:number size},${4:number lifetime=1},${5:boolean ignoreZ=false})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays an axis indicator at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: Box
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Box(${1:Vector origin},${2:Vector mins},${3:Vector maxs},${4:number lifetime=1},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays a solid coloured cube at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: BoxAngles
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.BoxAngles(${1:Vector pos},${2:Vector mins},${3:Vector maxs},${4:Angle ang},${5:number lifetime=1},${6:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays a solid colored rotated cube at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: Cross
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Cross(${1:Vector position},${2:number size},${3:number lifetime=1},${4:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )},${5:boolean ignoreZ=false})
debugoverlay.desc: Creates a coloured cross at the specified position for the specified time.

debugoverlay.name: EntityTextAtPosition
debugoverlay.desc: Displays 2D text at the specified coordinates.

debugoverlay.name: Grid
debugoverlay.desc: Draws a 3D grid of limited size in given position.

debugoverlay.name: Line
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Line(${1:Vector pos1},${2:Vector pos2},${3:number lifetime=1},${4:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )},${5:boolean ignoreZ=false})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays a coloured line at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: ScreenText
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.ScreenText(${1:number x},${2:number y},${3:string text},${4:number lifetime=1},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays text triangle at the specified coordinates.

debugoverlay.name: Sphere
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Sphere(${1:Vector origin},${2:number size},${3:number lifetime=1},${4:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )},${5:boolean ignoreZ=false})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays a coloured sphere at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: SweptBox
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.SweptBox(${1:Vector vStart},${2:Vector vEnd},${3:Vector vMins},${4:Vector vMaxs},${5:Angle ang},${6:number lifetime=1},${7:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays "swept" box, two boxes connected with lines by their verices.

debugoverlay.name: Text
debugoverlay.desc: Displays text at the specified position.

debugoverlay.name: Triangle
debugoverlay.snippet: debugoverlay.Triangle(${1:Vector pos1},${2:Vector pos2},${3:Vector pos3},${4:number lifetime=1},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )},${6:boolean ignoreZ=false})
debugoverlay.desc: Displays a colored triangle at the specified coordinates.

derma.name: Color
derma.desc: Gets the color from a Derma skin of a panel and returns default color if not found

derma.name: DefineControl
derma.desc: Defines a new Derma control with an optional base

derma.name: DefineSkin
derma.desc: Defines a new skin so that it is usable by Derma. The default skin can be found in "garrysmod/lua/skins/default.lua"

derma.name: GetDefaultSkin
derma.desc: Returns the default skin table, which can be changed with the hook [[GM/ForceDermaSkin]]

derma.name: GetNamedSkin
derma.desc: Returns the skin table of the skin with the supplied name

derma.name: GetSkinTable
derma.desc: Returns a copy of the table containing every Derma skin

derma.name: RefreshSkins
derma.desc: Clears all cached panels so that they reassess which skin they should be using.

derma.name: SkinChangeIndex
derma.desc: Returns how many times {{LibraryFunction|derma|RefreshSkins}} has been called.

derma.name: SkinHook
derma.snippet: derma.SkinHook(${1:string type},${2:string name},${3:Panel panel},${4:number w},${5:number h})
derma.desc: Calls the specified hook for the given panel

derma.name: SkinTexture
derma.desc: Returns a function to draw a specified texture of panels skin.

dragndrop.name: Clear
dragndrop.desc: Clears all the internal drag'n'drop variables.

dragndrop.name: Drop
dragndrop.desc: {{Internal}}Handles the drop action of drag'n'drop library.

dragndrop.name: GetDroppable
dragndrop.desc: Returns a table of currently dragged panels.

dragndrop.name: HandleDroppedInGame
dragndrop.desc: If returns true, calls {{LibraryFunction|dragndrop|StopDragging}} in {{LibraryFunction|dragndrop|Drop}}. Seems to be broken and does nothing. Is it for override?

dragndrop.name: IsDragging
dragndrop.desc: Returns whether the user is dragging something with the drag'n'drop system.

draw.name: DrawText
draw.snippet: draw.DrawText(${1:string text},${2:string font="DermaDefault"},${3:number x=0},${4:number y=0},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255, 255 )},${6:number xAlign=TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT})
draw.desc: Simple draw text at position, but this will expand newlines and tabs.

draw.name: GetFontHeight
draw.desc: Returns the height of the specified font in pixels.

draw.name: NoTexture
draw.desc: Sets drawing texture to a default white texture (vgui/white). Useful for resetting the drawing texture.

draw.name: RoundedBox
draw.snippet: draw.RoundedBox(${1:number cornerRadius},${2:number x},${3:number y},${4:number width},${5:number height},${6:table color})

draw.name: RoundedBoxEx
draw.snippet: draw.RoundedBoxEx(${1:number cornerRadius},${2:number x},${3:number y},${4:number width},${5:number height},${6:table color},${7:boolean roundTopLeft=false},${8:boolean roundTopRight=false},${9:boolean roundBottomLeft=false},${10:boolean roundBottomRight=false})
draw.desc: Draws a rounded rectangle. This function also lets you specify which corners are drawn rounded.

draw.name: SimpleText
draw.snippet: draw.SimpleText(${1:string text},${2:string font="DermaDefault"},${3:number x=0},${4:number y=0},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255, 255 )},${6:number xAlign=TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT},${7:number yAlign=TEXT_ALIGN_TOP})

draw.name: SimpleTextOutlined
draw.snippet: draw.SimpleTextOutlined(${1:string Text},${2:string font="DermaDefault"},${3:number x=0},${4:number y=0},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255, 255 )},${6:number xAlign=TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT},${7:number yAlign=TEXT_ALIGN_TOP},${8:number outlinewidth},${9:table outlinecolor=Color( 255, 255, 255, 255 )})
draw.desc: Creates a simple line of text that is outlined.

draw.name: Text
draw.desc: Works like {{LibraryFunction|draw|SimpleText}} but uses a table structure instead.

draw.name: TextShadow
draw.desc: Works like {{LibraryFunction|draw|Text}}, but draws the text as a shadow.

draw.name: TexturedQuad
draw.desc: Draws a texture with a table structure.

draw.name: WordBox

math.desc: Returns the arc tangents of the given number.

math.desc: Basic code for Bezier-Spline algorithm.

math.name: ceil
math.desc: Ceils or rounds a number up.

math.desc: Clamps a number between a minimum and maximum value

math.name: cos
math.desc: Returns cosine of given angle.

math.name: cosh
math.desc: Returns hyperbolic cosine of the given number.

math.name: deg
math.desc: Converts radians to degrees.

math.desc: {{Deprecated|You should use {{LibraryFunction|math|Distance}} instead}}

math.desc: If no value is specified, a random float value between 0-1 will be returned, if the first value is specified, a integer value between 1 and the specified value will be returned, if both values are specified, a integer value between the first and the second value will be returned, all inputs are rounded.
