navmesh.desc: Returns the highest ID of all nav areas on the map. While this can be used to get all nav areas, this number may not actually be the actual number of nav areas on the map.

navmesh.name: GetNavAreaByID
navmesh.desc: Returns a CNavLadder by the given ID.

navmesh.name: GetNearestNavArea
navmesh.snippet: navmesh.GetNearestNavArea(${1:Vector pos},${2:boolean anyZ=false},${3:number maxDist=10000},${4:boolean checkLOS=false},${5:boolean checkGround=true},${6:number team=TEAM_ANY=-2})
navmesh.desc: Returns the closest CNavArea to given position at the same height, or beneath it.

navmesh.name: GetPlayerSpawnName
navmesh.desc: Returns the classname of the player spawn entity.

navmesh.name: IsGenerating
navmesh.desc: Whether we're currently generating a new navmesh with {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}.

navmesh.name: IsLoaded
navmesh.desc: Returns true if a {{Lib|navmesh}} has been loaded when loading the map.

navmesh.name: Load
navmesh.desc: Loads a new {{Lib|navmesh}} from the .nav file for current map discarding any changes made to the {{Lib|navmesh}} previously.

navmesh.name: Reset
navmesh.desc: Deletes every CNavArea}} and {{Type|CNavLadder on the map '''without saving the changes'''.

navmesh.name: Save
navmesh.desc: Saves any changes made to {{Lib|navmesh}} to the .nav file.

navmesh.name: SetMarkedArea
navmesh.desc: Sets the CNavArea as marked, so it can be used with editing console commands.

navmesh.name: SetMarkedLadder
navmesh.desc: Sets the CNavLadder as marked, so it can be used with editing console commands.

navmesh.name: SetPlayerSpawnName
navmesh.desc: Sets the classname of the default spawn point entity, used before generating a new navmesh with {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}.

net.name: Broadcast
net.desc: Sends the currently built net message to all connected players.

net.name: BytesWritten
net.desc: Returns the size of the current message in bytes.

net.name: Incoming
net.desc: {{Internal|You may be looking for {{LibraryFunction|net|Receive}}.}}

net.name: ReadAngle
net.desc: Reads an angle from the received net message.

net.name: ReadBit
net.desc: Reads a bit from the received net message.

net.name: ReadBool
net.desc: Reads a boolean from the received net message.

net.name: ReadColor
net.desc: Reads a {{Struct|Color}} from the current net message.

net.name: ReadData
net.desc: Reads pure binary data from the message.

net.name: ReadDouble
net.desc: Reads a double-precision number from the received net message.

net.name: ReadEntity
net.desc: Reads an entity from the received net message. You should always check if the specified entity exists as it may have been removed and therefor NULL if it is outside of the players PVS or was already removed.

net.name: ReadFloat
net.desc: Reads a floating point number from the received net message.

net.name: ReadHeader
net.desc: Returns the "header" of the message which contains a short which can be converted to the corresponding message name via {{LibraryFunction|util|NetworkIDToString}}.

net.name: ReadInt
net.desc: Reads an integer from the received net message.

net.name: ReadMatrix
net.desc: Reads a VMatrix from the received net message.

net.name: ReadNormal
net.desc: Reads a normal vector from the net message.

net.name: ReadString
net.desc: Reads a null terminated string from the net stream. The size of the string is 8 bits plus 8 bits for every ASCII character in the string.

net.name: ReadTable
net.desc: Reads a table from the received net message.

net.name: ReadType
net.desc: Reads a value from the net message with the specified type.

net.name: ReadUInt
net.desc: Reads an unsigned integer with the specified number of bits from the received net message.

net.name: ReadVector
net.desc: Reads a vector from the received net message.  Vectors sent by this function are compressed, which may result in precision loss. See {{LibraryFunction|net|WriteVector}} for more information.

net.name: Receive
net.desc: Adds a net message handler. Only one receiver can be used to receive the net message.

net.name: Send
net.desc: Sends the current message to the specified player, or to all players listed in the table.

net.name: SendOmit
net.desc: Sends the current message to all except the specified, or to all except all players in the table.

net.name: SendPAS
net.desc: Sends the message to all players that are in the same potentially audible set(PAS) as the position, or simply said, it adds all players that can potentially hear sounds from this position.

net.name: SendPVS
net.desc: Sends the message to all players the position is in the PVS of or, more simply said, sends the message to players that can potentially see this position.

net.name: SendToServer
net.desc: Sends the current message to the server.

net.name: Start
net.desc: Begins a new net message.

net.name: WriteAngle
net.desc: Writes an angle to the current net message.

net.name: WriteBit
net.desc: Appends a boolean (as 1 or 0) to the current net message.

net.name: WriteBool
net.desc: Appends a boolean to the current net message. Alias of {{LibraryFunction|net|WriteBit}}

net.name: WriteColor
net.desc: Appends a {{Struct|Color}} to the current net message.

net.name: WriteData
net.desc: Writes a chunk of binary data to the message.

net.name: WriteDouble
net.desc: Appends a double-precision number to the current net message.

net.name: WriteEntity
net.desc: Appends an entity to the current net message.

net.name: WriteFloat
net.desc: Appends a float (number with decimals) to the current net message.

net.name: WriteInt
net.desc: Appends an integer (number without decimals) to the current net message.

net.name: WriteMatrix
net.desc: Writes a VMatrix to the current net message.

net.name: WriteNormal
net.desc: Writes a normalized/direction vector ( Vector with length of 1 ) to the net message.

net.name: WriteString
net.desc: Appends a string to the current net message. The size of the string is 8 bits plus 8 bits for every ASCII character in the string. The maximum allowed length of a single written string is 65533 characters.

net.name: WriteTable
net.desc: Appends a table to the current net message.

net.name: WriteType
net.desc: Appends any type of value to the current net message.

net.name: WriteUInt
net.desc: Appends an unsigned integer with the specified number of bits to the current net message.

net.name: WriteVector
net.desc: Appends a vector to the current net message.

notification.name: AddLegacy
notification.desc: Adds a standard notification to your screen.

notification.name: AddProgress
notification.desc: Adds a notification with an animated progress bar.

numpad.name: Activate
numpad.desc: Activates numpad key owned by the player

numpad.name: Deactivate
numpad.desc: Deactivates numpad key owned by the player

numpad.name: FromButton
numpad.desc: Returns true during a function added with {{LibraryFunction| numpad|Register}} when the third argument to {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Activate}} is true.

numpad.name: OnDown
numpad.desc: Calls a function registered with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Register}} when a player presses specified key.

numpad.name: OnUp
numpad.desc: Calls a function registered with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Register}} when a player releases specified key.

numpad.name: Register
numpad.desc: Registers a numpad library action for use with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}} and {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}}

numpad.name: Remove
numpad.desc: Removes a function added by either {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}} or {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}}

numpad.name: Toggle
numpad.desc: Either runs {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Activate}} or {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Deactivate}} depending on the key's current state

os.name: clock
os.desc: Returns the approximate cpu time the application ran.

os.name: date
os.desc: Returns the date/time as a formatted string or in a table.

os.name: difftime
os.desc: Subtracts the second of the first value and rounds the result.

os.name: time
os.desc: Returns the system time in seconds past the unix epoch. If a table is supplied, the function attempts to build a system time with the specified table members.

package.name: seeall
package.desc: Sets a metatable for module with its __index field referring to the global environment, so that this module inherits values from the global environment. To be used as an option to {{GlobalFunction|module}}.

physenv.name: AddSurfaceData
physenv.desc: {{Deprecated}}Loads the given surface properties as a string, follows the file format.

physenv.name: GetPerformanceSettings
physenv.desc: Gets the current performance settings in table form.

physenv.name: SetGravity
physenv.desc: Sets the directional gravity, does not work on players.

player_manager.name: AddValidHands
player_manager.desc: Assigns view model hands to player model.

player_manager.name: AddValidModel
player_manager.desc: Associates a simplified name with a path to a valid player model.

player_manager.name: AllValidModels
player_manager.desc: Returns the entire list of valid player models.

player_manager.name: ClearPlayerClass
player_manager.desc: Clears a player's class association by setting their ClassID to 0

player_manager.name: OnPlayerSpawn
player_manager.desc: Applies basic class variables when the player spawns.

player_manager.name: RegisterClass
player_manager.desc: Register a class metatable to be assigned to players later

player_manager.name: RunClass
player_manager.desc: Execute a named function within the player's set class

player_manager.name: TranslatePlayerHands
player_manager.desc: Retrieves correct hands for given player model. By default returns citizen hands.

player_manager.name: TranslatePlayerModel
player_manager.desc: Returns the valid model path for a simplified name.

player_manager.name: TranslateToPlayerModelName
player_manager.desc: Returns the simplified name for a valid model path of a player model.

player.name: CreateNextBot
player.desc: Similar to the serverside command "bot", this function creates a new Player bot with the given name. This bot will not obey to the usual "bot_*" commands, and it's the same bot base used in TF2 and CS:S.

player.name: GetAll
player.desc: Gets all the current players in the server (not including connecting clients).

player.name: GetBots
player.desc: Returns a table of all bots on the server.

player.name: GetByID
player.desc: Gets the player with the specified connection ID.

player.name: GetBySteamID
player.desc: Gets the player with the specified SteamID.

player.name: GetBySteamID64
player.desc: Gets the player with the specified SteamID64.

player.name: GetByUniqueID
player.desc: Gets the player with the specified uniqueID (not recommended way to identify players).

player.name: GetHumans
player.desc: Returns a table of all human ( non bot/AI ) players.

presets.name: Add
presets.desc: Adds preset to a preset group.

presets.name: GetTable
presets.desc: Returns a table with preset names and values from a single preset group.

presets.name: Remove
presets.desc: Removes a preset entry from a preset group.

properties.name: Add
properties.desc: Add properties to the properties module

properties.name: GetHovered
properties.desc: Returns an entity player is hovering over with his cursor.

properties.name: OnScreenClick
properties.desc: Checks if player hovers over any entities and open a properties menu for it.

properties.name: OpenEntityMenu
properties.desc: Opens properties menu for given entity.

render.name: AddBeam
render.desc: Adds a beam segment to the beam started by {{LibraryFunction|render|StartBeam}}.

render.name: BlurRenderTarget
render.desc: Blurs the render target ( or a given texture )

render.name: Capture
render.desc: Captures a part of the current render target and returns the data as a binary string in the given format.

render.name: CapturePixels
render.desc: Dumps the current render target and allows the pixels to be accessed by {{LibraryFunction|render|ReadPixel}}.

render.name: Clear
render.snippet: render.Clear(${1:number r},${2:number g},${3:number b},${4:number a},${5:boolean clearDepth},${6:boolean clearStencil})
render.desc: Clears the current render target and the specified buffers.

render.name: ClearBuffersObeyStencil
render.snippet: render.ClearBuffersObeyStencil(${1:number r},${2:number g},${3:number b},${4:number a},${5:boolean depth})
render.desc: Clears the current rendertarget for obeying the current stencil buffer conditions.

render.name: ClearDepth
render.desc: Resets the depth buffer.

render.name: ClearRenderTarget
render.desc: Clears a render target

render.name: ClearStencil
render.desc: Resets all values in the stencil buffer to zero.

render.name: ClearStencilBufferRectangle
render.desc: Sets the stencil value in a specified rect.

render.name: ComputeDynamicLighting
render.desc: Calculates the lighting caused by dynamic lights for the specified surface.

render.name: ComputeLighting
render.desc: Calculates the light color of a certain surface.

render.name: CopyRenderTargetToTexture
render.desc: Copies the currently active Render Target to the specified texture.

render.name: CopyTexture
render.desc: Copies the contents of one texture to another

render.name: CullMode
render.desc: Changes the cull mode.

render.name: DepthRange
render.desc: Set's the depth range of the upcoming render.

render.name: DrawBeam
render.snippet: render.DrawBeam(${1:Vector startPos},${2:Vector endPos},${3:number width},${4:number textureStart},${5:number textureEnd},${6:table color})
render.desc: Draws textured beam.

render.name: DrawBox
render.snippet: render.DrawBox(${1:Vector position},${2:Angle angles},${3:Vector mins},${4:Vector maxs},${5:table color},${6:boolean writeZ})
render.desc: Draws a box in 3D space.

render.name: DrawLine
render.desc: Draws a line in 3D space.

render.name: DrawQuad
render.snippet: render.DrawQuad(${1:Vector vert1},${2:Vector vert2},${3:Vector vert3},${4:Vector vert4},${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})
render.desc: Draws 2 connected triangles.

render.name: DrawQuadEasy
render.snippet: render.DrawQuadEasy(${1:Vector position},${2:Vector normal},${3:number width},${4:number height},${5:table color},${6:number rotation})
render.desc: Draws a quad.

render.name: DrawScreenQuad
render.desc: Draws the the current material to the whole screen.

render.name: DrawScreenQuadEx
render.desc: Draws the the current material to the area specified.

render.name: DrawSphere
render.snippet: render.DrawSphere(${1:Vector position},${2:number radius},${3:number longitudeSteps},${4:number latitudeSteps},${5:table color})
render.desc: Draws a sphere in 3D space. The material previously set with {{LibraryFunction|render|SetMaterial}} will be applied the sphere's surface.

render.name: DrawSprite
render.desc: Draws a sprite in 3d space.

render.name: DrawTextureToScreen
render.desc: Draws a texture over the whole screen.

render.name: DrawTextureToScreenRect
render.desc: Draws a textured rectangle.

render.name: DrawWireframeBox
render.snippet: render.DrawWireframeBox(${1:Vector position},${2:Angle angle},${3:Vector mins},${4:Vector maxs},${5:table color},${6:boolean writeZ})
render.desc: Draws a wireframe box in 3D space.

render.name: DrawWireframeSphere
render.snippet: render.DrawWireframeSphere(${1:Vector position},${2:number radius},${3:number longitudeSteps},${4:number latitudeSteps},${5:table color},${6:boolean writeZ=false})
render.desc: {{Validate}}

render.name: EnableClipping
render.desc: Sets the status of the clip renderer, returning previous state.

render.name: EndBeam
render.desc: Ends the beam mesh of a beam started with {{LibraryFunction|render|StartBeam}}.

render.name: FogColor
render.desc: Sets the color of the fog.

render.name: FogEnd
render.desc: Sets the at which the fog reaches its max density.

render.name: FogMaxDensity
render.desc: Sets the maximum density of the fog.

render.name: FogMode
render.desc: Sets the mode of fog.

render.name: FogStart
render.desc: Sets the distance at which the fog starts showing up.

render.name: GetAmbientLightColor
render.desc: Returns the ambient color of the map.

render.name: GetBlend
render.desc: Returns the current alpha blending.

render.name: GetColorModulation
render.desc: Returns the current color modulation values as normals.

render.name: GetDXLevel
render.desc: Returns the maximum available directX version.

render.name: GetFogColor
render.desc: Returns the current fog color.

render.name: GetFogDistances
render.desc: Returns the fog start and end distance.

render.name: GetFogMode
render.desc: Returns the fog mode.

render.name: GetFullScreenDepthTexture
render.desc: Returns the _rt_FullFrameDepth texture. Alias of _rt_PowerOfTwoFB

render.name: GetLightColor
render.desc: Gets the light exposure on the specified position.

render.name: GetPowerOfTwoTexture
render.desc: Returns the render target's power of two texture.

render.name: GetRefractTexture
render.desc: Alias of {{LibraryFunction|render|GetPowerOfTwoTexture}}.

render.name: GetRenderTarget
render.desc: Returns the currently active render target.

render.name: GetResolvedFullFrameDepth
render.desc: Returns the _rt_ResolvedFullFrameDepth texture for SSAO depth.

render.name: GetScreenEffectTexture
render.desc: Obtain an ITexture}} of the screen. You must call {{LibraryFunction|render|UpdateScreenEffectTexture in order to update this texture with the currently rendered scene.

render.name: GetSuperFPTex
render.desc: <onlyinclude>Returns a floating point texture the same resolution as the screen.

render.name: GetSuperFPTex2
render.desc: {{:render/GetSuperFPTex}}

render.name: GetSurfaceColor
render.desc: Performs a render trace and returns the color of the surface hit, this uses a low res version of the texture.

render.name: GetToneMappingScaleLinear
render.desc: Returns a vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

render.name: MaterialOverride
render.desc: Sets the render material override for all next calls of {{ClassFunction|Entity|DrawModel}}. Also overrides {{LibraryFunction|render|MaterialOverrideByIndex}}.

render.name: MaterialOverrideByIndex
render.desc: Similar to {{LibraryFunction|render|MaterialOverride}}, but overrides the materials per index.

render.name: MaxTextureHeight
render.desc: Returns the maximum texture height the renderer can handle.

render.name: MaxTextureWidth
render.desc: Returns the maximum texture width the renderer can handle.

render.name: Model
render.desc: Creates a new {{GlobalFunction|ClientsideModel}}, renders it at the specified pos/ang, and removes it. Can also be given an existing CSEnt to reuse instead.

render.name: ModelMaterialOverride
render.desc: Sets a material to override a model's default material. Similar to {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetMaterial}} except it uses an IMaterial argument and it can be used to change materials on models which are part of the world geometry.

render.name: OverrideAlphaWriteEnable
render.desc: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the alpha channel of the current render target.

render.name: OverrideColorWriteEnable
render.desc: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the color channel of the current render target.

render.name: OverrideDepthEnable
render.desc: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the depth buffer.

render.name: PopCustomClipPlane
render.desc: Removes the current active clipping plane from the clip plane stack.

render.name: PopFilterMag
render.desc: Pops the current texture magnification filter from the filter stack.

render.name: PopFilterMin
render.desc: Pops the current texture minification filter from the filter stack.

render.name: PopFlashlightMode
render.desc: Pops the current flashlight mode from the flashlight mode stack.

render.name: PopRenderTarget
render.desc: Pops the last render target and viewport from the RT stack and sets them as the current render target and viewport.

render.name: PushCustomClipPlane
render.desc: Pushes a new clipping plane of the clip plane stack and sets it as active.

render.name: PushFilterMag
render.desc: Pushes a texture filter onto the magnification texture filter stack.

render.name: PushFilterMin
render.desc: Pushes a texture filter onto the minification texture filter stack.

render.name: PushFlashlightMode
render.desc: Enables the flashlight projection for the upcoming rendering.

render.name: PushRenderTarget
render.snippet: render.PushRenderTarget(${1:ITexture texture},${2:number x=0},${3:number y=0},${4:number w=texture:Width()},${5:number h=texture:Height()})
render.desc: Pushes the current render target and viewport to the RT stack then sets a new current render target and viewport. If the viewport is not specified, the dimensions of the render target are used instead.

render.name: ReadPixel
render.desc: Reads the color of the specified pixel from the RenderTarget sent by {{LibraryFunction|render|CapturePixels}}

render.name: RedownloadAllLightmaps
render.desc: This applies the changes made to map lighting using {{LibraryFunction|engine|LightStyle}}.

render.name: RenderHUD
render.desc: Renders the HUD on the screen.

render.name: RenderView
render.desc: Renders the scene with the specified viewData to the current active render target.

render.name: ResetModelLighting
render.desc: Resets the model lighting to the specified color.

render.name: ResetToneMappingScale
render.desc: Resets the HDR tone multiplier to the specified value.

render.name: SetAmbientLight
render.desc: Sets the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation.

render.name: SetBlend
render.desc: Sets the alpha blending for every upcoming render operation.

render.name: SetColorMaterial
render.desc: Sets the current drawing material to "color".

render.name: SetColorMaterialIgnoreZ
render.desc: Sets the current drawing material to "color_ignorez".

render.name: SetColorModulation
render.desc: Sets the color modulation.

render.name: SetFogZ
render.desc: If the fog mode is set to [[Enums/MATERIAL_FOG|MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z]], the fog will only be rendered below the specified height.

render.name: SetGoalToneMappingScale
render.desc: Sets the goal HDR tone mapping scale.

render.name: SetLightingMode
render.desc: Sets lighting mode when rendering something.

render.name: SetLightingOrigin
render.desc: Sets the lighting origin.

render.name: SetLightmapTexture
render.desc: Sets the texture to be used as the lightmap in upcoming rendering operations. This is required when rendering meshes using a material with a lightmapped shader such as LightmappedGeneric.

render.name: SetLocalModelLights
render.desc: Sets up the local lighting for any upcoming render operation. Up to 4 local lights can be defined, with one of three different types (point, directional, spot).

render.name: SetMaterial
render.desc: Sets the material to be used in any upcoming render operation.

render.name: SetModelLighting
render.desc: Sets up the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation. Ambient lighting can be seen as a cube enclosing the object to be drawn, each of its faces representing a directional light source that shines towards the object. Thus, there is a total of six different light sources that can be configured separately.

render.name: SetRenderTarget
render.desc: Sets the render target to the specified rt.

render.name: SetRenderTargetEx
render.desc: Sets the render target with the specified index to the specified rt.

render.name: SetScissorRect
render.snippet: render.SetScissorRect(${1:number startX},${2:number startY},${3:number endX},${4:number endY},${5:boolean enable})
render.desc: Sets a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.

render.name: SetShadowColor
render.desc: Sets the shadow color.

render.name: SetShadowDirection
render.desc: Sets the shadow projection direction.

render.name: SetShadowDistance
render.desc: Sets the maximum shadow projection range.

render.name: SetStencilCompareFunction
render.desc: Sets the compare function of the stencil.

render.name: SetStencilEnable
render.desc: Sets whether stencil tests are carried out for each rendered pixel.

render.name: SetStencilFailOperation
render.desc: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was not successful.

render.name: SetStencilPassOperation
render.desc: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was successful.

render.name: SetStencilReferenceValue
render.desc: Sets the reference value which will be used for all stencil operations. This is an unsigned integer.

render.name: SetStencilTestMask
render.desc: Sets the unsigned 8-bit test bitflag mask to be used for any stencil testing.

render.name: SetStencilWriteMask
render.desc: Sets the unsigned 8-bit write bitflag mask to be used for any writes to the stencil buffer.

render.name: SetStencilZFailOperation
render.desc: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the stencil test is passed but the depth buffer test fails.

render.name: SetViewPort
render.desc: Changes the view port position and size.

render.name: Spin
render.desc: Swaps the frame buffers/cycles the frame. In other words, this updates the screen.

render.name: StartBeam
render.desc: Start a new beam draw operation.

render.name: SupportsHDR
render.desc: Returns whether the game supports HDR, i.e. if the DirectX level is higher than or equal to 8.

render.name: SupportsPixelShaders_1_4
render.desc: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 1.4.

render.name: SupportsPixelShaders_2_0
render.desc: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 2.0.

render.name: SupportsVertexShaders_2_0
render.desc: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of vertex shaders 2.0.

render.name: SuppressEngineLighting
render.desc: Suppresses or enables any engine lighting for any upcoming render operation.

render.name: TurnOnToneMapping
render.desc: Enables HDR tone mapping which influences the brightness.

render.name: UpdateFullScreenDepthTexture
render.desc: Updates the texture returned by {{LibraryFunction|render|GetFullScreenDepthTexture}}.

render.name: UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture
render.desc: Updates the power of two texture.

render.name: UpdateRefractTexture
render.desc: Pretty much alias of {{LibraryFunction|render|UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture}} but does not return the texture.

render.name: UpdateScreenEffectTexture
render.desc: Copies the entire screen to the screen effect texture, which can be acquired via {{LibraryFunction|render|GetScreenEffectTexture}}. This function is mainly intended to be used in {{HookFunction|GM|RenderScreenspaceEffects}}

resource.name: AddFile
resource.desc: Adds the specified and all related files to the files the client should download.

resource.name: AddSingleFile
resource.desc: Adds the specified file to the files the client should download.

resource.name: AddWorkshop
resource.desc: Adds a workshop addon for the client to download before entering the server.

saverestore.name: AddRestoreHook
saverestore.desc: Adds a restore/load hook for the Half-Life 2 save system.

saverestore.name: AddSaveHook
saverestore.desc: Adds a save hook for the Half-Life 2 save system. You can this to carry data through level transitions in Half-Life 2.

saverestore.name: LoadEntity
saverestore.desc: Loads {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}} from the save game file that is being loaded and merges it with the given entitys {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}}.

saverestore.name: ReadTable
saverestore.desc: Reads a table from the save game file that is being loaded.

saverestore.name: ReadVar
saverestore.desc: Loads a variable from the save game file that is being loaded.

saverestore.name: SaveEntity
saverestore.desc: Saves entitys {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}} to the save game file that is being saved.

saverestore.name: WritableKeysInTable
saverestore.desc: Returns how many writable keys are in the given table.

saverestore.name: WriteTable
saverestore.desc: Write a table to a save game file that is being saved.

saverestore.name: WriteVar
saverestore.desc: Writes a variable to the save game file that is being saved.

scripted_ents.name: Alias
scripted_ents.desc: Defines an alias string that can be used to refer to another classname

scripted_ents.name: Get
scripted_ents.desc: Returns a copy of the ENT table for a class, including functions defined by the base class

scripted_ents.name: GetList
scripted_ents.desc: Returns a copy of the list of all ENT tables registered

scripted_ents.name: GetMember
scripted_ents.desc: Retrieves a member of entity's table.

scripted_ents.name: GetSpawnable
scripted_ents.desc: Returns a list of all ENT tables which contain either ENT.Spawnable or ENT.AdminSpawnable

scripted_ents.name: GetStored
scripted_ents.desc: Returns the actual ENT table for a class. Modifying functions/variables in this table will change newly spawned entities

scripted_ents.name: GetType
scripted_ents.desc: Returns the 'type' of a class, this will one of the following: 'anim', 'ai', 'brush', 'point'.

scripted_ents.name: Register
scripted_ents.desc: Registers an ENT table with a classname. Reregistering an existing classname will automatically update the functions of all existing entities of that class.

search.name: AddProvider
search.desc: Adds a search result provider. For examples, see gamemodes/sandbox/gamemode/cl_search_models.lua

serverlist.name: PlayerList
serverlist.desc: Queries a server for its player list.

serverlist.name: Query
serverlist.desc: Queries the master server for server list.

sound.name: Add
sound.desc: Creates a sound script. It can also override sounds, which seems to only work when set on the server.

sound.name: AddSoundOverrides
sound.desc: Overrides sounds defined inside of a txt file; typically used for adding map-specific sounds.

sound.name: Generate
sound.desc: Creates a sound from a function.

sound.name: GetTable
sound.desc: Returns a list of all registered sound scripts.

sound.name: Play
sound.snippet: sound.Play(${1:string Name},${2:Vector Pos},${3:number Level},${4:number Pitch},${5:number Volume})
sound.desc: Plays a sound from the specified position in the world.

sound.name: PlayFile
sound.desc: Plays a file from GMod directory. You can find a list of all error codes [http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html here]

sound.name: PlayURL
sound.desc: Allows you to play external sound files, as well as online radio streams.

spawnmenu.name: ActivateTool
spawnmenu.desc: Activates a tool, opens context menu and brings up the tool gun.

spawnmenu.name: ActivateToolPanel
spawnmenu.desc: Activates tools context menu in specified tool tab.

spawnmenu.name: ActiveControlPanel
spawnmenu.desc: Returns currently opened control panel of a tool, post process effect or some other menu in spawnmenu.

spawnmenu.name: AddContentType
spawnmenu.desc: Registers a new content type that is saveable into spawnlists.

spawnmenu.name: AddCreationTab
spawnmenu.desc: Inserts a new tab into the CreationMenus table, which will be used by the creation menu to generate its tabs (Spawnlists, Weapons, Entities, etc.)

spawnmenu.name: AddPropCategory
spawnmenu.snippet: spawnmenu.AddPropCategory(${1:string filename},${2:string name},${3:table contents},${4:string icon},${5:number id=math.random( 1000, 9999 )},${6:number parentID=0},${7:string needsApp=""})
spawnmenu.desc: Used to populate prop categories in the spawnmenu tree. This function should generally be called within {{HookFunction|SANDBOX|PopulatePropMenu}}.

spawnmenu.name: AddToolCategory
spawnmenu.desc: Used to create a new category in the list inside of a spawnmenu ToolTab.

spawnmenu.name: AddToolMenuOption
spawnmenu.snippet: spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption(${1:string tab},${2:string category},${3:string class},${4:string name},${5:string cmd},${6:string config},${7:function cpanel},${8:table })
spawnmenu.desc: Adds an option to the right side of the spawnmenu

spawnmenu.name: AddToolTab
spawnmenu.desc: Used to create a new Utility tab inside of the spawnmenu to place more content into. You must call from from {{HookFunction|SANDBOX|AddToolMenuTabs}} for it to add work correctly.

spawnmenu.name: CreateContentIcon
spawnmenu.desc: Creates a new content icon.

spawnmenu.name: DoSaveToTextFiles
spawnmenu.desc: {{Internal}}

spawnmenu.name: GetContentType
spawnmenu.desc: Returns the function to create an vgui element for a specified content type

spawnmenu.name: GetCreationTabs
spawnmenu.desc: Gets the CreationMenus table, which was filled with creation menu tabs from {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|AddCreationTab}}.

spawnmenu.name: GetPropTable
spawnmenu.desc: Returns a table of all prop categories and their props in the spawnmenu. Note that if the spawnmenu has not been populated, this will return an empty table.

spawnmenu.name: GetTools
spawnmenu.desc: Gets a table of tools on the client.

spawnmenu.name: PopulateFromEngineTextFiles
spawnmenu.desc: {{Internal}}

spawnmenu.name: PopulateFromTextFiles
spawnmenu.desc: Loads spawnlists from text files.

spawnmenu.name: SaveToTextFiles
spawnmenu.desc: {{Internal}}

spawnmenu.name: SetActiveControlPanel
spawnmenu.desc: Sets currently active control panel to be returned by {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|ActiveControlPanel}}.

spawnmenu.name: SwitchToolTab
spawnmenu.desc: {{Deprecated}}

sql.name: Begin
sql.desc: Tells the engine a set of queries is coming. Will wait until {{LibraryFunction|sql|Commit}} is called to run them.

sql.name: Commit
sql.desc: Tells the engine to execute a series of queries queued for execution, must be preceded by {{LibraryFunction|sql|Begin}}

sql.name: LastError
sql.desc: Returns the last error from a SQLite query.

sql.name: Query
sql.desc: Performs a query on the local SQLite database, returns a table as result set, nil if result is empty and false on error.

sql.name: QueryRow
sql.desc: Performs the query like {{LibraryFunction|sql|Query}}, but returns the first row found.

sql.name: QueryValue
sql.desc: Performs the query like {{LibraryFunction|sql|Query}}, but returns the first value found.

sql.name: SQLStr
sql.desc: Escapes dangerous characters and symbols from user input used in an SQLite SQL Query.

sql.name: TableExists
sql.desc: Returns if the table with the specified name exists.

steamworks.name: Download
steamworks.desc: Downloads a file from the supplied addon and saves it as a .cache file in garrysmod/cache folder.

steamworks.name: FileInfo
steamworks.desc: Retrieves info about supplied Steam Workshop addon.

steamworks.name: GetList
steamworks.snippet: steamworks.GetList(${1:string type},${2:table tags},${3:number offset},${4:number numRetrieve},${5:number days},${6:string userID},${7:function resultCallback})
steamworks.desc: Retrieves a customized list of Steam Workshop addons.

steamworks.name: GetPlayerName
steamworks.desc: Retrieves players name by his 64bit SteamID.

steamworks.name: IsSubscribed
steamworks.desc: Returns whenever the client is subscribed to the specified Steam Workshop item.

steamworks.name: OpenWorkshop
steamworks.desc: Opens the workshop website in the steam overlay browser.

steamworks.name: Publish
steamworks.snippet: steamworks.Publish(${1:table tags},${2:string filename},${3:string image},${4:string name},${5:string desc})

steamworks.name: RequestPlayerInfo
steamworks.desc: Requests information of the player with SteamID64 for later use with {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|GetPlayerName}}.

steamworks.name: SetFilePlayed
steamworks.desc: Sets whether you have played this addon or not. This will be shown to the user in the Steam Workshop itself:

steamworks.name: SetShouldMountAddon
steamworks.desc: Sets if an addon should be enabled or disabled. Call {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|ApplyAddons}} afterwards to update.

steamworks.name: ShouldMountAddon
steamworks.desc: Returns whenever the specified Steam Workshop addon will be mounted or not.

steamworks.name: Unsubscribe
steamworks.desc: {{Internal}} Unsubscribes to the specified workshop addon. Call {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|ApplyAddons}} afterwards to update.

steamworks.name: ViewFile
steamworks.desc: Opens the workshop website for specified Steam Workshop item in the Steam overlay browser.

steamworks.name: Vote
steamworks.desc: {{Internal}} Makes the user vote for the specified addon

steamworks.name: VoteInfo
steamworks.desc: Retrieves vote info of supplied addon.

string.name: byte
string.desc: Returns the given string's characters in their numeric ASCII representation.

string.name: char
string.desc: Takes the given numerical bytes and converts them to a string.

string.name: Comma
string.desc: Inserts commas for every third digit.

string.name: dump
string.desc: Returns the binary bytecode of the given function.

string.name: EndsWith
string.desc: Returns whether or not the second passed string matches the end of the first.

string.name: Explode
string.desc: Splits a string up wherever it finds the given separator.

string.name: find
string.desc: Attempts to find the specified substring in a string, uses [[Patterns]] by default.

string.name: format
string.desc: Formats the specified values into the string given.

string.name: FormattedTime
string.desc: Returns the time as a formatted string or as a table if no format is given.

string.name: FromColor
string.desc: Creates a string from a Color variable.

string.name: GetChar
string.desc: {{Deprecated|Use either string.sub(str, index, index) or str[index].}} Returns char value from the specified index in the supplied string.

string.name: GetExtensionFromFilename
string.desc: Returns extension of the file.

string.name: GetFileFromFilename
string.desc: Returns file name and extension.

string.name: GetPathFromFilename
string.desc: Returns the path only from a file's path.

string.name: gfind
string.desc: {{Deprecated|This function is removed in Lua versions later than what GMod is currently using. Use {{LibraryFunction|string|gmatch}} instead.}}Returns an iterator function that is called for every complete match of the pattern, all sub matches will be passed as to the loop.

string.name: gmatch
string.desc: Using [[Patterns]], returns an iterator which will return either one value if no capture groups are defined, or any capture group matches.

string.name: gsub
string.desc: This functions main purpose is to replace certain character sequences in a string using [[Patterns]].

string.name: Implode
string.desc: Joins the values of a table together to form a string.

string.name: JavascriptSafe
string.desc: Escapes special characters for JavaScript in a string, making the string safe for inclusion in to JavaScript strings.

string.name: Left
string.desc: Returns everything left of supplied place of that string.

string.name: len
string.desc: Counts the number of characters in the string (length). This is equivalent to using the length operator (#).

string.name: lower
string.desc: Changes any upper-case letters in a string to lower-case letters.

string.name: match
string.desc: Finds a [[Patterns|Pattern]] in a string.

string.name: NiceSize
string.desc: Converts a digital filesize to human-readable text.

string.name: NiceTime
string.desc: Converts supplied number into string.

string.name: PatternSafe
string.desc: Escapes all special characters within a string, making the string safe for inclusion in a Lua pattern.

string.name: rep
string.desc: Repeats a string by the provided number, with an optional separator.

string.name: Replace
string.desc: Replaces all occurrences of the supplied second string.

string.name: reverse
string.desc: Reverses a string.

string.name: Right
string.desc: Returns the last n-th characters of the string.

string.name: SetChar
string.desc: Sets the character at the specific index of the string.

string.name: Split
string.desc: Splits the string into a table of strings, separated by the second argument.

string.name: StartWith
string.desc: Returns whether or not the first string starts with the second.

string.name: StripExtension
string.desc: Removes the extension of a path.

string.name: sub
string.desc: Returns a sub-string, starting from the character at position ''StartPos'' of the string (inclusive), and optionally ending at the character at position ''EndPos'' of the string (also inclusive). If EndPos is not given, the rest of the string is returned.

string.name: ToColor
string.desc: Fetches a Color type from a string.

string.name: ToMinutesSeconds
string.desc: Returns given time in "MM:SS" format.

string.name: ToMinutesSecondsMilliseconds
string.desc: Returns given time in "MM:SS:MS" format.

string.name: ToTable
string.desc: Splits the string into characters and creates a sequential table.

string.name: Trim
string.desc: Removes leading and trailing matches of a string.

string.name: TrimLeft
string.desc: Removes leading spaces/characters from a string.

string.name: TrimRight
string.desc: Removes trailing spaces/passed character from a string.

string.name: upper
string.desc: Changes any lower-case letters in a string to upper-case letters.

surface.name: CreateFont
surface.desc: Creates a new font.

surface.name: DisableClipping
surface.desc: Enables or disables the clipping used by the VGUI that limits the drawing operations to a panels bounds.

surface.name: DrawCircle
surface.snippet: surface.DrawCircle(${1:number originX},${2:number originY},${3:number radius},${4:number r},${5:number g},${6:number b},${7:number a=255})
surface.desc: Draws a hollow circle, made of dots. For a filled circle, see examples for {{LibraryFunction|surface|DrawPoly}}.

surface.name: DrawLine
surface.desc: Draws a line from one point to another.

surface.name: DrawOutlinedRect
surface.desc: Draws a hollow box with a border width of 1 px.

surface.name: DrawPoly
surface.desc: Draws a polygon with a maximum of 256 vertices.

surface.name: DrawRect
surface.desc: Draws a solid rectangle on the screen.

surface.name: DrawText
surface.desc: Draw the specified text on the screen, using the previously set position, font and color.

surface.name: DrawTexturedRect
surface.desc: Draw a textured rectangle with the given position and dimensions on the screen, using the current active texture.

surface.name: DrawTexturedRectRotated
surface.desc: Draw a textured rotated rectangle with the given position and dimensions and angle on the screen, using the current active texture.

surface.name: DrawTexturedRectUV
surface.snippet: surface.DrawTexturedRectUV(${1:number x},${2:number y},${3:number width},${4:number height},${5:number startU},${6:number startV},${7:number endU},${8:number endV})
surface.desc: Draws a textured rectangle with a repeated or partial texture. U and V refer to texture coordinates. 0,0 is the bottom left corner of the texture, 1,0 is the bottom right, 1,1 is the top right and 0,1 is the top left.

surface.name: GetHUDTexture
surface.desc: Gets the HUD texture with the specified name.

surface.name: GetTextSize
surface.desc: Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the given text, but only if the font has been set with {{LibraryFunction|surface|SetFont}}.

surface.name: GetTextureID
surface.desc: Returns the texture id of the material with the given name/path.

surface.name: GetTextureSize
surface.desc: Returns the size of the texture with the associated texture ID.

surface.name: PlaySound
surface.desc: Play a sound file directly on the client (such as UI sounds, etc).

surface.name: ScreenHeight
surface.desc: {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|ScrH}}() instead.}} Returns the height of the current client's screen.

surface.name: ScreenWidth
surface.desc: {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|ScrW}}() instead.}} Returns the width of the current client's screen.

surface.name: SetAlphaMultiplier
surface.desc: Sets a multiplier that will influence all upcoming drawing operations.

surface.name: SetDrawColor
surface.desc: Set the color of any future shapes to be drawn, can be set by either using r, g, b, a as separate values or by a {{Struct|Color}}. Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.

surface.name: SetFont
surface.desc: Set the current font to be used for text operations later.

surface.name: SetMaterial
surface.desc: Sets the material to be used in all upcoming surface draw operations.

surface.name: SetTextColor
surface.desc: Set the color of any future text to be drawn, can be set by either using r, g, b, a as separate values or by a {{Struct|Color}}. Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.

surface.name: SetTextPos
surface.desc: Set the position to draw any future text.

surface.name: SetTexture
surface.desc: Sets the texture to be used in all upcoming surface draw operations.

system.name: AppTime
system.desc: Returns the total uptime of the current application.

system.name: FlashWindow
system.desc: Flashes the window. Currently works only on Windows.

system.name: GetCountry
system.desc: Returns the country code of this computer, determined by the localisation settings of the OS.

system.name: HasFocus
system.desc: Returns whether or not the game window has focus.

system.name: IsLinux
system.desc: Returns whether the current OS is Linux.

system.name: IsOSX
system.desc: Returns whether the current OS is OSX.

system.name: IsWindowed
system.desc: Returns whether the game is being run in a window or in fullscreen (you can change this by opening the menu, clicking 'Options', then clicking the 'Video' tab, and changing the Display Mode using the dropdown menu):

system.name: IsWindows
system.desc: Returns whether the current OS is Windows.

system.name: SteamTime
system.desc: Returns the synchronized steam time. This is the number of seconds since the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time Unix epoch].

system.name: UpTime
system.desc: Returns the total uptime of operating system.

table.name: Add
table.desc: Adds the contents from one table into another.

table.name: ClearKeys
table.desc: Changes all keys to sequential integers. This creates a new table object and does not affect the original.

table.name: CollapseKeyValue
table.desc: Collapses a table with keyvalue structure

table.name: concat
table.desc: Concatenates the contents of a table to a string.

table.name: Copy
table.desc: Creates a deep copy and returns that copy

table.name: CopyFromTo
table.desc: Empties the target table, and merges all values from the source table into it.

table.name: Count
table.desc: Counts the amount of keys in a table. This should only be used when a table is not numerically and sequentially indexed. For those tables, consider the length operator.

table.name: DeSanitise
table.desc: Converts a table that has been sanitised with {{LibraryFunction|table|Sanitise}} back to its original form

table.name: Empty
table.desc: Removes all values from a table.

table.name: FindNext
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, iterate the table using ipairs or increment from the previous index. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.}}

table.name: FindPrev
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, iterate your table with ipairs, storing the previous value and checking for the target. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.}}

table.name: ForceInsert
table.desc: Inserts a value in to the given table even if the table is non-existent

table.name: foreach
table.desc: {{Deprecated|This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use {{GlobalFunction|pairs}}() instead.}} Iterates for each key-value pair in the table, calling the function with the key and value of the pair. If the function returns anything, the loop is broken.

table.name: ForEach
table.desc: {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|pairs}}() instead.}} Iterates over a table and calls the given function for each key and value found. Unlike {{LibraryFunction|table|foreach}}, this ignores the value returned by the function.

table.name: foreachi
table.desc: {{Deprecated|This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use {{GlobalFunction|ipairs}}() instead.}} Iterates for each numeric index in the table in order.

table.name: GetFirstKey
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, expect the first key to be 1.

table.name: GetFirstValue
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, index the table with a key of 1.

table.name: GetKeys
table.desc: Returns all keys of a table.

table.name: GetLastKey
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, use the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.}}

table.name: GetLastValue
table.desc: {{Deprecated|Instead, index the table with the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.}}

table.name: getn
table.desc: {{Deprecated|This function was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and is removed in 5.2. Use the length (#) operator instead.}} Returns the length of the table.

table.name: GetWinningKey
table.desc: Returns a key of the supplied table with the highest number value.

table.name: HasValue
table.desc: Checks if a table has a value.

table.name: Inherit
table.desc: Copies any missing data from base to target, and sets the target's ''BaseClass'' member to the base table's pointer.

table.name: insert
table.desc: Inserts a value into a table at the end of the table or at the given position.

table.name: IsSequential
table.desc: Returns whether or not the table's keys are sequential

table.name: KeyFromValue
table.desc: Returns the first key found to be containing the supplied value

table.name: KeysFromValue
table.desc: Returns a table of keys containing the supplied value

table.name: LowerKeyNames
table.desc: Returns a copy of the input table with all string keys converted to be lowercase recursively

table.name: maxn
table.desc: Returns the highest numerical key.

table.name: Merge
table.desc: Merges the content of the second table with the content in the first one

table.name: Random
table.desc: Returns a random value from the supplied table.

table.name: remove
table.desc: Removes a value from a table and shifts any other values down to fill the gap.

table.name: RemoveByValue
table.desc: Removes the first instance of a given value from the specified table with {{LibraryFunction|table|remove}}, then returns the key that the value was found at.

table.name: Reverse
table.desc: Returns a reversed copy of a sequential table. Any non-sequential and non-numeric keyvalue pairs will not be copied.

table.name: Sanitise
table.desc: Converts Vector}}s, {{Type|Angle}}s and {{Type|boolean}}s to be able to be converted to and from key-values. {{LibraryFunction|table|DeSanitise does the opposite

table.name: sort
table.desc: Sorts a table either ascending or by the given sort function.

table.name: SortByKey
table.desc: Returns a list of keys sorted based on values of those keys.

table.name: SortByMember
table.desc: Sorts a table by a named member

table.name: SortDesc
table.desc: Sorts a table in reverse order from {{LibraryFunction|table|sort}}

table.name: ToString
table.desc: Converts a table into a string

team.name: AddScore
team.desc: Increases the score of the given team

team.name: BestAutoJoinTeam
team.desc: Returns the team index of the team with the least players. Falls back to TEAM_UNASSIGNED

team.name: GetAllTeams
team.desc: Returns a table consisting of information on every defined team

team.name: GetClass
team.desc: Returns the selectable classes for the given team. This can be added to with [[team/SetClass]]

team.name: GetColor
team.desc: Returns the team's color.

team.name: GetName
team.desc: Returns the name of the team.

team.name: GetPlayers
team.desc: Returns a table with all player of the specified team.

team.name: GetScore
team.desc: Returns the score of the team.

team.name: GetSpawnPoint
team.desc: Returns a table of valid spawnpoint classes the team can use. These are set with {{LibraryFunction|team|SetSpawnPoint}}.

team.name: GetSpawnPoints
team.desc: Returns a table of valid spawnpoint entities the team can use. These are set with  {{LibraryFunction|team|SetSpawnPoint}}.

team.name: Joinable
team.desc: Returns if a team is joinable or not. This is set in {{LibraryFunction|team|SetUp}}.

team.name: NumPlayers
team.desc: Returns the amount of players in a team.

team.name: SetClass
team.desc: Sets valid classes for use by a team. Classes can be created using {{LibraryFunction|player_manager|RegisterClass}}

team.name: SetColor
team.desc: Sets the team's color.

team.name: SetScore
team.desc: Sets the score of the given team

team.name: SetSpawnPoint
team.desc: Sets valid spawnpoint classes for use by a team.

team.name: SetUp
team.desc: Creates a new team.

team.name: TotalDeaths
team.desc: Returns the sum of deaths of all players of the team.

team.name: TotalFrags
team.desc: Get's the total frags in a team.

team.name: Valid
team.desc: Returns true if the given team index is valid

timer.name: Adjust
timer.desc: Adjusts the timer if the timer with the given identifier exists.

timer.name: Destroy
timer.desc: {{Deprecated|You should be using {{LibraryFunction|timer|Remove}} instead.}} Stops and destroys the given timer. Alias of {{LibraryFunction|timer|Remove}}.

timer.name: Exists
timer.desc: Returns whenever the given timer exists or not.

timer.name: RepsLeft
timer.desc: Returns amount of repetitions/executions left before the timer destroys itself.

timer.name: Simple
timer.desc: Runs the given function after a specified delay.

timer.name: TimeLeft
timer.desc: Returns amount of time left (in seconds) before the timer executes its function.

timer.name: Toggle
timer.desc: Runs either {{LibraryFunction|timer|Pause}} or {{LibraryFunction|timer|UnPause}} based on the timer's current status.

umsg.name: Angle
umsg.desc: Writes an angle to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Bool
umsg.desc: Writes a bool to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Char
umsg.desc: Writes a signed char to the usermessage.

umsg.name: End
umsg.desc: Dispatches the usermessage to the client(s).

umsg.name: Entity
umsg.desc: Writes an entity object to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Float
umsg.desc: Writes a float to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Long
umsg.desc: Writes a signed int (32 bit) to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Short
umsg.desc: Writes a signed short (16 bit) to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Start
umsg.desc: {{Deprecated|You should be using {{Lib|net}} library instead}}Starts a new usermessage.

umsg.name: String
umsg.desc: Writes a null terminated string to the usermessage.

umsg.name: Vector
umsg.desc: Writes a Vector to the usermessage.

umsg.name: VectorNormal
umsg.desc: Writes a vector normal to the usermessage.

undo.name: AddEntity
undo.desc: Adds an entity to the current undo block

undo.name: AddFunction
undo.desc: Adds a function to call when the current undo block is undone

undo.name: Do_Undo
undo.desc: Processes an undo block (in table form). This is used internally by the undo manager when a player presses Z.

undo.name: Finish
undo.desc: Completes an undo entry, and registers it with the player's client

undo.name: GetTable
undo.desc: Serverside, returns a table containing all undo blocks of all players. Clientside, returns a table of the local player's undo blocks.

undo.name: ReplaceEntity
undo.desc: Replaces any instance of the "from" reference with the "to" reference, in any existing undo block. Returns true if something was replaced

undo.name: SetCustomUndoText
undo.desc: Sets a custom undo text for the current undo block

undo.name: SetPlayer
undo.desc: Sets the player which the current undo block belongs to

usermessage.name: GetTable
usermessage.desc: Returns a table of every usermessage hook

usermessage.name: Hook
usermessage.desc: Sets a hook for the specified to be called when a usermessage with the specified name arrives

usermessage.name: IncomingMessage
usermessage.desc: Called by the engine when a usermessage arrives, this method calls the hook function specified by {{LibraryFunction|usermessage|Hook}} if any.

utf8.name: char
utf8.desc: Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

utf8.name: codepoint
utf8.desc: Returns the codepoints (as numbers) from all characters in the given string that start between byte position startPos and endPos. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence. This functions similarly to {{LibraryFunction|string|byte}}.

utf8.name: char
utf8.desc: Returns an iterator (like {{LibraryFunction|string|gmatch}}) which returns both the position and codepoint of each utf8 character in the string. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence.

utf8.name: force
utf8.desc: Forces a string to contain only valid UTF-8 data. Invalid sequences are replaced with U+FFFD (the Unicode replacement character).

utf8.name: len
utf8.desc: Returns the number of UTF-8 sequences in the given string between positions startPos and endPos (both inclusive). If it finds any invalid UTF-8 byte sequence, returns false as well as the position of the first invalid byte.

utf8.name: offset
utf8.snippet: utf8.offset(${1:string string},${2:number n},${3:number startPos=1 when n>=0, -1 otherwise})
utf8.desc: Returns the byte-index of the n'th UTF-8-character after the given startPos (nil if none). startPos defaults to 1 when n is positive and -1 when n is negative. If n is zero, this function instead returns the byte-index of the UTF-8-character startPos lies within.

util.name: AddNetworkString
util.desc: Adds the specified string to a string table, which will cache it and network it to all clients automatically.

util.name: AimVector
util.snippet: util.AimVector(${1:Angle ViewAngles},${2:number ViewFOV},${3:number x},${4:number y},${5:number scrWidth},${6:number scrHeight})
util.desc: Function used to calculate aim vector from 2D screen position. It is used in SuperDOF calculate Distance.

util.name: Base64Encode
util.desc: Encodes the specified string to base64.

util.name: BlastDamage
util.snippet: util.BlastDamage(${1:Entity inflictor},${2:Entity attacker},${3:Vector damageOrigin},${4:number damageRadius},${5:number damage})
util.desc: Applies explosion damage to all entities in the specified radius.

util.name: BlastDamageInfo
util.desc: Applies spherical damage based on damage info to all entities in the specified radius.

util.name: Compress
util.desc: Compresses the given string using LZMA.

util.name: CRC
util.desc: Generates the checksum of the specified string.

util.name: DateStamp
util.desc: Returns the current date formatted like '2012-10-31 18-00-00'

util.name: Decal
util.desc: Performs a trace and paints a decal to the surface hit.

util.name: DecalEx
util.snippet: util.DecalEx(${1:IMaterial material},${2:Entity ent},${3:Vector position},${4:Vector normal},${5:table color},${6:number w},${7:number h})
util.desc: Performs a trace and paints a decal to the surface hit.

util.name: DecalMaterial
util.desc: Gets the full material path by the decal name.

util.name: Decompress
util.desc: Decompresses the given string using LZMA.

util.name: DistanceToLine
util.desc: Gets the distance between a line and a point in 3d space.

util.name: Effect
util.desc: Creates a effect with the specified data.

util.name: GetModelInfo
util.desc: Returns a table containing the info about the model. It seems to be not working serverside, but still exists serverside.

util.name: GetPData
util.desc: Gets PData of an offline player using their SteamID

util.name: GetPixelVisibleHandle
util.desc: Creates a new PixVis handle.

util.name: GetPlayerTrace
util.desc: Utility function to quickly generate a trace table that starts at the players view position, and ends 16384 units along a specified direction.

util.name: GetSunInfo
util.desc: Gets information about the sun position and obstruction or nil if there is no sun.

util.name: GetSurfaceIndex
util.desc: Returns the matching surface index for the surface name.

util.name: GetSurfacePropName
util.desc: Returns a name of surfaceproperties ID.

util.name: GetUserGroups
util.desc: Returns a table of all SteamIDs that have a usergroup.

util.name: IntersectRayWithOBB
util.snippet: util.IntersectRayWithOBB(${1:Vector rayStart},${2:Vector rayDirection},${3:Vector boxOrigin},${4:Angle boxAngles},${5:Vector boxMins},${6:Vector boxMaxs})
util.desc: Performs a ray box intersection and returns position, normal and the fraction.

util.name: IntersectRayWithPlane
util.desc: Performs a ray plane intersection and returns the hit position or nil.

util.name: IsInWorld
util.desc: Checks if a certain position in within the world bounds.

util.name: IsModelLoaded
util.desc: Checks if the model is loaded in the game.

util.name: IsSkyboxVisibleFromPoint
util.desc: Returns whenever the skybox is visibile from the point specified.

util.name: IsValidModel
util.desc: Checks if the specified model is valid.

util.name: IsValidPhysicsObject
util.desc: Checks if given numbered physics object of given entity is valid or not. Most useful for ragdolls.

util.name: IsValidProp
util.desc: Checks if the specified prop is valid.

util.name: IsValidRagdoll
util.desc: Checks if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll.

util.name: JSONToTable
util.desc: Converts a JSON string to a Lua table.

util.name: KeyValuesToTable
util.desc: Converts a KeyValue string to a Lua table.

util.name: KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder
util.desc: Similar to {{LibraryFunction|util|KeyValuesToTable}} but it also preserves order of keys.

util.name: LocalToWorld
util.desc: Returns a vector in world coordinates based on an entity and local coordinates

util.name: NetworkIDToString
util.desc: Returns the networked string associated with the given ID from the string table.

util.name: NetworkStringToID
util.desc: Returns the networked ID associated with the given string from the string table.

util.name: NiceFloat
util.desc: Formats a float by stripping off extra 0's and .'s

util.name: ParticleTracer
util.desc: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

util.name: ParticleTracerEx
util.snippet: util.ParticleTracerEx(${1:string name},${2:Vector startPos},${3:Vector endPos},${4:boolean doWhiz},${5:number entityIndex},${6:number attachmentIndex})
util.desc: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

util.name: PixelVisible
util.desc: Returns the visibility of the PixVis with the specified parameters, visibility ranges from 0-1.

util.name: PointContents
util.desc: Returns the contents of the position specified.

util.name: PrecacheModel
util.desc: Precaches a model for later use. Model is cached after being loaded once.

util.name: PrecacheSound
util.desc: Precaches a sound for later use. Sound is cached after being loaded once.

util.name: QuickTrace
util.desc: Performs a trace with the given origin, direction and filter.

util.name: RelativePathToFull
util.desc: Returns the absolute system path the file relative to /garrysmod/.

util.name: RemovePData
util.desc: Removes PData of offline player using his SteamID

util.name: ScreenShake
util.snippet: util.ScreenShake(${1:Vector pos},${2:number amplitude},${3:number frequency},${4:number duration},${5:number radius})
util.desc: Makes the screen shake

util.name: SetPData
util.desc: Sets PData for offline player using his SteamID

util.name: SharedRandom
util.desc: Generates a random float value that should be the same on client and server.

util.name: SpriteTrail
util.snippet: util.SpriteTrail(${1:Entity ent},${2:number attachmentID},${3:table color},${4:boolean additive},${5:number startWidth},${6:number endWidth},${7:number lifetime},${8:number textureRes},${9:string texture})
util.desc: Adds a trail to the specified entity.

util.name: Stack
util.desc: Returns a new Stack object

util.name: SteamIDFrom64
util.desc: Given a 64bit SteamID will return a STEAM_0: style Steam ID

util.name: SteamIDTo64
util.desc: Given a STEAM_0 style Steam ID will return a 64bit Steam ID

util.name: StringToType
util.desc: Converts a string to the specified type.

util.name: TableToJSON
util.desc: Converts a table to a JSON string.

util.name: TableToKeyValues
util.desc: Converts the given table into a key value string.

util.name: Timer
util.desc: Creates a timer object.

util.name: TimerCycle
util.desc: Returns the time since this function has been last called

util.name: tobool
util.desc: {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|tobool}} instead.}}

util.name: TraceEntity
util.desc: Runs a trace using the ent's collisionmodel between two points.

util.name: TraceEntityHull
util.desc: {{Deprecated|This function is broken and returns the same values all the time}}

util.name: TraceHull
util.desc: Performs a hull trace with the given trace data. This function is shared but will not give the desired results on the client; you should only use this serverside as the function utilizes certain physics mechanisms that do not exist on the client.

util.name: TraceLine
util.desc: Performs a trace with the given trace data.

util.name: TypeToString
util.desc: Converts a type to a (nice, but still parsable) string

vgui.name: Create
vgui.desc: Creates a panel by the specified classname.

vgui.name: CursorVisible
vgui.desc: Returns whenever the cursor is currently active and visible.

vgui.name: FocusedHasParent
vgui.desc: Returns whether the currently focused panel is a child of the given one.

vgui.name: GetControlTable
vgui.desc: Gets the method table of this panel. Does not return parent methods!

vgui.name: GetHoveredPanel
vgui.desc: Returns the panel the cursor is hovering above.

vgui.name: GetKeyboardFocus
vgui.desc: Returns the panel which is currently receiving keyboard input.

vgui.name: GetWorldPanel
vgui.desc: Returns the global world panel which is the parent to all others.

vgui.name: IsHoveringWorld
vgui.desc: Returns whenever the cursor is hovering the world panel.

vgui.name: Register
vgui.desc: Registers a panel for later creation.

vgui.name: RegisterFile
vgui.desc: Registers a new VGUI panel from a file.

vgui.name: RegisterTable
vgui.desc: Registers a table to use as a panel. All this function does is assigns Base key to your table and returns the table.

weapons.name: Get
weapons.desc: Get copy of weapon table by name. If all you need to do is access a variable from the weapon table, use {{LibraryFunction|weapons|GetStored}} instead.

weapons.name: GetList
weapons.desc: Get a list of all the registered SWEPs. This does not include weapons added to spawnmenu manually.

weapons.name: GetStored
weapons.desc: Gets the REAL weapon table, not a copy.

weapons.name: Register
weapons.desc: Used to register your SWEP with the engine.

widgets.name: PlayerTick
widgets.desc: {{Internal}} Automatically called to update all widgets.
